comment.text:
I tested on Fedora 25 Alpha with Tomcat 8 from RPM and with Wildfly from ZIP. It works, it correctly clean installs and updates.
I gathered some feedback on the network configuration, so I enhanced the [default config](http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/mod_cluster.git/tree/mod_cluster.conf?id=cd4a0f1604a51148e8d4723fed213251d902cf21) "tool tips" and [README](http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/mod_cluster.git/tree/README.fedora#n57). It's coming up in the next update 1.3.3-8.


karma: +1
I, the Submitter, posted the previous "anonymous" comment. I just wasn't logged in...
Dear Bodhi, push to updates-testing, please :-)
Dear Bodhi, push to updates-testing, please :-)
I tested mod_cluster, mod_cluster-java, mod_cluster-java-tomcat8 with tomcat8 (1:8.0.36-2.fc25) and it works fine.
Works  on my test VM, both update and clean install, httpd + tomcat 8.

long_desc.thetext:
The contents of wildfly/bin after using wildfly-cp script are as follows:

#!/bin/sh

JBOSS_BASE_DIR=. /usr/share/jboss-as/bin/standalone.sh -c standalone.xml


There is no jboss on my machine, so the script doesn't run.

After editing the standalone.sh file to use wildfly instead of jboss I get the following error: The logging.properties files is owner wildfly and permissions rw------.

Unable to read the logging configuration from 'file:/usr/share/wildfly/standalone/configuration/logging.properties' (java.io.FileNotFoundException: /usr/share/wildfly/standalone/configuration/logging.properties (Permission denied))

I am facing the same issue on latest Fedora 20 X86_64 3.17.8-200. I had installed wildfly-8.1.0-3.fc20.noarch.rpm.

From /usr/share/wildfly/bin folder i issued the following command as root user:

wildfly-cp -l /home/admin/wildfly-cp

The o/p if as follows:
cp: cannot stat ‘/usr/share/jboss-as/docs/examples/configs/standalone.xml’: No such file or directory
cp: cannot stat ‘/usr/share/jboss-as/docs/examples/properties/logging.properties’: No such file or directory
cp: cannot stat ‘/usr/share/jboss-as/docs/examples/properties/mgmt-users.properties’: No such file or directory
chmod: cannot access ‘/home/admin/wildfly-cp/configuration/mgmt-users.properties’: No such file or directory
Directory /home/admin/wildfly-cp is prepared to launch WildFly AS!

You can now boot your instance: /home/admin/wildfly-cp/bin/standalone.sh

As mentioned by Karl the standalone.sh point to following path which does not exists:
/usr/share/jboss-as/bin/standalone.sh


wildfly-cp seems to be broken at multiple places.
I'll fix it as part of the upgrade to 8.2.0.Final.
Will we get 8.2.0 update on Fedora 20?
No, it seems that Fedora 20 will not get the update, I don't have time to backport all the required changes.

This message is a reminder that Fedora 20 is nearing its end of life.

and issuing updates for Fedora 20. It is Fedora's policy to close all
bug reports from releases that are no longer maintained. At that time
this bug will be closed as EOL if it remains open with a Fedora  'version'
of '20'.

plan to fix it in a currently maintained version, simply change the 'version' 
to a later Fedora version.

to see this bug fixed and are able to reproduce it against a later version

version prior this bug is closed as described in the policy above.

Although we aim to fix as many bugs as possible during every release's 
lifetime, sometimes those efforts are overtaken by events. Often a 
more recent Fedora release includes newer upstream software that fixes 
bugs or makes them obsolete.

security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug.

current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this

Current version/release in rawhide: 1.2.6-7.fc24
URL: https://github.com/modcluster/mod_cluster/tags

Required by wildfly 10+

Hello Gil, we are on it, progress tracked in BZ 1247243
Scratch builds f24: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1247243#c8

(In reply to Michal Karm Babacek from comment #1)
> Hello Gil, we are on it, progress tracked in BZ 1247243
> Scratch builds f24: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1247243#c8

i dont understand why a new review request if the package is still live in different branches ?

https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/mod_cluster/

updates progress to wildfly 10+ you can find here
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/WildFly

@Gil

There is no need for a formal Review Request process per se; I created the BZ 1247243 long time ago when the situation was different (I wasn't a maintainer at the time).

As soon as we are satisfied with the updated package, I will resolve the issue and push the update to Fedora 24, 25 and rawhide.

ETA: ~ a week or so

@Gil
I updated https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/WildFly with the mod_cluster version we would like to have in Wildfly. It's 1.3.3.Final these days, not 1.3.1.Final.
@Gil https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1247243#c16

Updated in Rawhide.
f24 and f25 will follow after preliminary testing.

-K-

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by karm.
Dear Bodhi, push to updates-testing, please :-)
This update has been pushed to testing.
Works  on my test VM, both update and clean install, httpd + tomcat 8.
This update has reached 7 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by karm.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes: Fixed remote exploits in Apache HTTP Server mod_manager and mod_proxy_cluster modules, fixed performance problems with shared memory, fixed thread pool off-by-one errors, enhanced Tomcat 8 interoperability, fixed mod_proxy integration, added WebSockets proxy layer for mod_cluster.
title: mod_cluster-1.3.3-8.fc24
